aside from: You use aside from when you are making an exception to a general statement.
have nothing to do with: If two things have nothing to do with each other, they are unrelated.
make a distinction: If you draw a distinction or make a distinction, you say that two things are different.
split into: If you split something into smaller pieces, it is divided into two or more parts.
wear away: If you wear something away or if it wears away, it becomes thin and eventually disappears because it is used a lot or rubbed a lot.
arise from: If something arises from a particular situation, it is created or caused by the situation.
